meanings.definition: Unable to be felt by touch.
meanings.sent1: The impalpability of the ghostly figure left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent2: The impalpability of the fine silk fabric amazed the fashion designers.
meanings.sent3: The impalpability of the invisible cloak made for some hilarious pranks.
meanings.sent4: The impalpability of the morning mist created a mystical atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The impalpability of the idea seemed almost magical in its mystery.

meanings.sent1: The impalpability of the complex scientific theory confused the students.
meanings.sent2: The impalpability of the concept required deep contemplation.
meanings.sent3: The impalpability of the joke took a while to sink in, but then caused laughter.
meanings.sent4: The impalpability of time slipping away felt like trying to catch a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The impalpability of the situation made it hard to find a solution.
